text: ðŸš¨ Measles vaccination saves lives! ðŸ’‰ According to the WHO, an estimated 57 million deaths were prevented between 2000-2022 thanks to accelerated immunization activities by countries, the Measles & Rubella Partnership, and other international partners. ðŸŒŽ Routine vaccination and mass campaigns in high-case rate countries are crucial for reducing global measles deaths. ðŸ’ª In 2022, 74% of children received both doses of the measles vaccine, and about 83% received one dose by their first birthday. ðŸŽ‰ The Measles & Rubella Initiative (now the Measles and Rubella Partnership) and Gavi supported measles vaccination efforts that prevented an estimated 57 million deaths, mostly in the WHO African Region and Gavi-supported countries. ðŸŒŸ Let's keep up the good work!
